user_request: A poem about stopping by woods on a snowy evening, with promises to keep.
final_poem:
The trees stand tall in winter's sleep
Their branches etched against the deep blue sky
Snowflakes gently falling all around
A soothing silence that whispers peace to found

I stop beneath their frozen boughs to stay
To breathe the crisp air and watch the snow drift away
My heart is filled with love and gentle care
For those I hold dear, for promises we share

The fire crackles in my thoughts of home
 Memories of laughter, tears that have been known
Yet here among these winter trees so still
I feel a sense of calm and peaceful will

Promises made to loved ones, true as can be
A bond between us, strong and free from care's decree
In this quiet moment I commit once more
To keep the vows we've spoken, forevermore.
